The truck is moving in the same direction, but its indicators or brake lights are not visible. The presence of this large vehicle is significant because its size and momentum could pose a potential hazard, especially if it makes sudden movements that could affect the lane the ego vehicle is traveling in.

Slightly ahead of the ego car, in the right adjacent lane, there is a silver sedan. It appears to be traveling at a consistent speed and does not have its indicators on. The sedan's position and potential actions are crucial to monitor, as it may decide to change lanes or adjust its speed, which would influence the traveling pace for the ego vehicle.

In the adjacent left lane, there is a green concrete mixer truck, easily identifiable by its revolving drum and bold green color. Although it is not in the same lane as the ego vehicle, any unexpected maneuvers from the mixer truck could impact the surrounding traffic, including the lane where the ego vehicle is.

On the left side of the road, metal barriers separate the sidewalk from the road. These barriers define the boundary of the roadway and restrict the ego car from moving laterally to the left.

There are no vulnerable road users, traffic lights, traffic cones, or other objects reported in the image that affect the driving behavior of the ego car.
